oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Military pass for John Ullean
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Recommendation from Military Governor Andrew Johnson of Tennessee for a military pass for John Ullean "to go out on Lebanon road to procure a raft to be brought here for the Government." Ullean's credentials are endorsed by Dr. R. Knaffe, Surgeon, 1st Tennessee Infantry, who credits Ullean as a "good and firm Union man."

Johnson was appointed Military Governor of Tennessee in February 1862 by President Lincoln; however, he did not arrive in Nashville until March 1862 to assume his official duties. This document, dated February 7, 1862, was signed prior to Johnson's arrival in Nashville. His location is unspecified.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Johnson, Andrew, 1808-1875; Military passes; Tennessee. Governor; United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
